rit.contoken
Interface DeviceConnectionInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
DeviceConnection
public interface DeviceConnectionInterface

Continuous Token Device Connection Interface (require an implementation)

Version:
1.0 Build 001 Sep 1, 2011.
Author:
Prach Chaisatien

Method Summary
 StatusMessage check(java.lang.String uid, java.lang.String token, java.lang.Object androidcontext)
          check the Token by sending device id (uid) and the Token (token) to the Continuous Token Server via the internet connection
 StatusMessage check(java.lang.String uname, java.lang.String pass, java.lang.String uid, java.lang.String token, java.lang.Object androidcontext)
          register a new device id (uid) and the Token (token) to the Continuous Token Server via the internet connection
 

Method Detail

check

StatusMessage check(java.lang.String uid,
                    java.lang.String token,
                    java.lang.Object androidcontext)
check the Token by sending device id (uid) and the Token (token) to the Continuous Token Server via the internet connection

Parameters:
uid - user id or device id
token - the Token to check
androidcontext - the Android context of the mobile application activity's class (to access the device connection status)
Returns:
StatusMessage indicate the checktoken operation status (success, failed, error etc...)
See Also:
android.content.Context, StatusMessage

check

StatusMessage check(java.lang.String uname,
                    java.lang.String pass,
                    java.lang.String uid,
                    java.lang.String token,
                    java.lang.Object androidcontext)
register a new device id (uid) and the Token (token) to the Continuous Token Server via the internet connection

Parameters:
uid - user id or device id
token - the Token to register
androidcontext - the Android context of the mobile application activity's class (to access the device connection status)
Returns:
StatusMessage indicate the registeruser operation status (success, failed, error etc...)
See Also:
android.content.Context, StatusMessage
